intro: Tithymalus macroceras, commonly known as the large-fruited tithymalus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, and its fruit is distinctive for its large, ribbed structure. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
